document.title: Edwin Hubble (Extract)
document.citation: Simple English Wikipedia: “Edwin Hubble”. Retrieved from https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Hubble on 20 Aug 2015.
document.body: In 1929 Hubble formulated what is called Hubble's law. The law states that the greater the distance between any two galaxies, the greater their relative speed of separation. Georges Lemaître, a Belgian priest and astronomer, had published the idea two years before in an obscure journal. Nevertheless, the idea bears Hubble's name to this day.
